trans-unit.source: Enables multiple collections and items to be displayed as a single list.
<xref:System.Windows.Data.CompositeCollection> can contain items such as strings, objects, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xml-md.md)] nodes, elements, as well as other collections.

An <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> uses the data in the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CompositeCollection> to generate its content according to its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemTemplate%2A>.

For more information about using <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> objects to bind to collections, see the Binding to Collections section of the [Data Binding Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview.md).
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.CompositeCollection"></xref> class that is empty and has default initial capacity.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.CompositeCollection"></xref> class that is empty and has a specified initial capacity.
The number of items that the new list is initially capable of storing.
Adds the specified item to this collection.
New item to add to the collection.
Zero-based index where the new item is added.
Clears the collection.
This method resets the collection to be empty.
Occurs when the collection changes, either by adding or removing an item.
Checks to see if a given item is in this collection.
The item to check.
`true` if the collection contains the given item; otherwise, `false`.
Makes a shallow copy of object references from this collection to the given array.
The array that is the destination of the copy operation.
Zero-based index in the target array at which the copying starts.
Gets the number of items stored in this collection.
A <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionContainer> object counts as 1 item.
The number of items stored in this collection.
Returns the index in this collection where the given item is found.
The item to retrieve the index for.
If the item appears in the collection, then the zero-based index in the collection where the given item is found; otherwise, -1.
Inserts an item in the collection at a given index.
All items after the given position are moved down by one.
The index to insert the item at.
The item reference to add to the collection.
If index is out of range.
Indexer property that retrieves or replaces the item at the given zero-based offset in the collection.
The zero-based offset of the item to retrieve or replace.
The item at the specified zero-based offset.
If the index is out of range.
Handles events from the centralized event table.
The type of the <xref href="System.Windows.WeakEventManager"></xref> calling this method.
This only recognizes manager objects of type <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.CollectionChangedEventManager"></xref>.
Object that originated the event.
Event data.
`true` if the listener handled the event; otherwise, `false`.
Removes the given item reference from the collection.
All remaining items move up by one.
The item to remove.
Removes an item from the collection at the given index.
All remaining items move up by one.
The index at which to remove an item.
If index is out of range.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
true if access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, false.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref>.
Returns an enumerator.
An IEnumerator object.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The view created.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The type of the <xref href="System.Windows.WeakEventManager"></xref> calling this method.
This only recognizes manager objects of type <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.CollectionChangedEventManager"></xref>.
Object that originated the event.
Event data.
`true` if the listener handled the event; otherwise, `false`.
